reviews.text: It doesn't work as a romantic drama, it is just bad.
reviews.author: Jillian Chilingerian

reviews.text: After We Collided has very little to work with, and it shows.
reviews.author: Cris Kennedy

reviews.text: Fifty Shades Light but if you're a fan of the books I'm sure you're going to love it
reviews.author: Amanda the Jedi

reviews.text: A series of half-digested movie tropes regurgitated by Google Rom-dram.
reviews.author: Tara Brady

reviews.text: Only meant for its young targeted audience that has the stomach for such tripe.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Director Roger Kumble brings this second installment of Anna Todd's series to life in a way fans of the books have been dreaming about for years.
reviews.author: Lauren Veneziani

reviews.text: Sequel has sex, partying, language, addiction, and fighting.
reviews.author: Jennifer Green

reviews.text: After We Collided is riddled with cliches and tired young adult tropes, but its dramatic romance and laughable dialogue offers some escapist fun.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: After We Collided doesn't earn a place in the so-bad-it's-good category it aspires to.
reviews.author: Jade Budowski

reviews.text: American "Afternators" will no doubt be similarly pleased with this slightly campier continuation of the series. For everyone else, however, there's not enough innovation to make the second installment a worthwhile jumping-on point.
reviews.author: Caroline Siede

reviews.text: Too moronic to work as a serious romantic drama and too boring to work as straightforward sleaze.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Full of tired cliches and formulaic story. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mar√≠a Alba

reviews.text: "After" was merely awful. "After We Collided" is atrocious.
reviews.author: Jessica Kiang

reviews.text: Admittedly, the result is a superior movie.... However, After We Collided is still plagued by terribly telegraphed twists, dreadful dialogue and the overuse of pop-songs to convey emotion.
reviews.author: James Croot

reviews.text: This is not a good movie in any sense of the word
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: As dull and lifeless as its predecessor.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

synopsis: A college student's relationship with a troubled youth gets put to the test when she meets another man who's attracted to her.
